item.title: Checkpoint Systems in Hong Kong is dedicated to preventing shoplifting
item.description:
Checkpoint Systems, a leading provider of retail merchandise availability solutions, has introduced innovative loss prevention and RFID solutions tailored for Hong Kong retailers. These solutions aim to safeguard valuable merchandise from loss and theft across the entire supply chain, from the manufacturer to the store shelf. Checkpoint’s enhanced Merchandise Visibility Solution utilizes cutting-edge labeling and RFID technology, allowing manufacturers to apply RFID tags cost-effectively at the point of manufacture. These tags enable real-time tracking and location identification of individual products throughout the supply chain...

item.title: Exploration of business systems in Asia
item.description:
Source: OUP. “The Oxford Handbook of Asian Business Systems”, edited by Michael Witt and Gordon Redding, is the first publication to examine business systems from India to Japan. Oxford University Press, the book’s publisher, states that existing research on “varieties of capitalism” (VOC) and “comparative business systems” heavily emphasizes Europe, Japan, and Anglo-Saxon countries. This book is the first to offer a thorough analysis of the institutional frameworks of most Asian countries and assess the applicability of current theories within the Asian context...
